ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Basic research for credit. If you want a chemistry degree you will probably have to take this class, so it doesn't really matter if I recommend it to you or not. Find a professor whose research seems interesting and find a good research mentor and it will be a good experience.
You do research in a lab and report back to your peers, with the added benefit of enjoying and appreciating their research. It's a fun class though can morph into an enormous time commitment.

This semester I had to complete the senior requirement, which involved writing a final paper and giving a poster session. The final paper was really not that bad since I'd already done the research - it wound up being about 20 pages double spaced, without figures, though we had to turn it in formatted like a JACS article. The poster session was only an hour long and pretty chill. Have fun!

It's research for credit, so you just go to the lab every week and attend an 1 hour Monday class (that only happens about half the time). If you are already interested in working in a lab, it won't really be extra work. Try to start on your paper early, because writing a paper does take quite a bit of time.
